Class DatabaseHelper

java.lang.Object
databasePart1.DatabaseHelper
public class DatabaseHelper extends Object

Title: DatabaseHelper Class.

Description: A Database Helper class that holds all of our methods taking data in and out of the database.

Copyright: CSE360 Team 8 @ 2025

Version:
1.00 2025-03-24 Implementing the database methods
Author:
CSE360 Team 8

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    User
    currentUser
    The User that is currently logged in.
    final QAHelper1
    qaHelper
    A QAHelper object to access the QA database methods.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    DatabaseHelper()
    A default constructor to initialize the database.

  • Field Details

    • currentUser

      public User currentUser
      The User that is currently logged in.

    • qaHelper

      public final QAHelper1 qaHelper
      A QAHelper object to access the QA database methods.

  • Constructor Details

    • DatabaseHelper

      public DatabaseHelper()
      A default constructor to initialize the database.

  • Method Details

    • connectToDatabase

      public void connectToDatabase() throws SQLException
      Sets up the main database and QA databases for testing. Set to drop the tables and repopulate the database depending on the flags set. There are helper methods that will populate both databases reliably .
      Throws:
      SQLException - if anything fails while setting up the DB.

    • isDatabaseEmpty

      public boolean isDatabaseEmpty() throws SQLException
      This is a helper method that will check if the database is empty All it checks for is if there is any data in the User table.
      Returns:
      boolean for if the database is empty
      Throws:
      SQLException - if it can not find the User table.

    • createNewRequest

      public void createNewRequest(String requestText, String userName) throws SQLException
      Creates a new request with the status 'OPEN' and no notes. The request is associated with the specified user and has originalId set to 0.
      Parameters:
      requestText - the content of the request
      userName - the username of the person creating the request
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs

    • getAllOpenRequests

      public List<Request> getAllOpenRequests() throws SQLException
      Retrieves all requests that are currently open or reopened.
      Returns:
      a list of open or reopened Request objects
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs

    • getAllClosedRequests

      public List<Request> getAllClosedRequests() throws SQLException
      Retrieves all requests that have been marked as closed.
      Returns:
      a list of closed Request objects
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs

    • closeRequest

      public void closeRequest(int requestId, String noteToAppend) throws SQLException
      Closes a request by updating its status to 'CLOSED' and appending an optional note.
      Parameters:
      requestId - the ID of the request to close
      noteToAppend - an optional note to append to the request's notes
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs

    • reopenRequest

      public void reopenRequest(int oldRequestId, String updatedDescription, String additionalNote, String reopenedBy) throws SQLException
      Reopens a closed request by creating a new request row with status 'REOPENED'. The new request references the original via originalId and contains merged notes.
      Parameters:
      oldRequestId - the ID of the closed request to be reopened
      updatedDescription - the new request text for the reopened request
      additionalNote - an optional note to append
      reopenedBy - the user who is reopening the request
      Throws:
      SQLException - if the original request is not closed or if a database access error occurs

    • addNoteToRequest

      public void addNoteToRequest(int requestId, String note) throws SQLException
      Adds a note to an existing request without changing its status.
      Parameters:
      requestId - the ID of the request to add a note to
      note - the note to be added
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs

    • getRequestById

      public Request getRequestById(int requestId) throws SQLException
      Retrieves a single request by its ID.
      Parameters:
      requestId - the ID of the request to retrieve
      Returns:
      the Request object with the given ID, or null if not found
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs

    • getAllReviewersForUser

      public Map<User,Integer> getAllReviewersForUser(int userId) throws SQLException
      Gets all of the reviewers that have been associated with the user. The user sets these in the GUI.
      Parameters:
      userId - the id for the user requesting their Reviewer list
      Returns:
      Map of Users and Integers for the reviewers and their weights
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error in accessing the column.

    • addReviewer

      public boolean addReviewer(int userId, User newReviewer, int weight)
      Function that will add a Reviewer ID to the User's list of Reviewers.
      Parameters:
      userId - the id for the user adding a reviewer
      newReviewer - The User object that represents the Reviewer to be added
      weight - The selected weight value the User has given to the Reviewer
      Returns:
      boolean

    • updateReviewers

      public boolean updateReviewers(Map<User,Integer> reviewers, int userId) throws SQLException
      Function that will allow the User to update their list of reviewers completely. Will update the whole list of reviewers, you should get current list of Reviewers first.
      Parameters:
      reviewers - Map of the Reviewers to be updated and their weights
      userId - the id for the user updating their Reviewer list
      Returns:
      boolean
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error in accessing the column.

    • updateReviewerWeight

      public boolean updateReviewerWeight(int userId, User reviewer, int newWeight)
      Allows the User to update an individual Reviewer's weights in their list of Reviewers.
      Parameters:
      userId - the id for the user updating their Reviewer list
      reviewer - The Reviewer object that will be updated.
      newWeight - The new weight that will be assigned to the reviewer.
      Returns:
      boolean

    • removeReviewer

      public boolean removeReviewer(int userId, User reviewer)
      Allows the User to remove an individual Reviewer from their Reviewer's list.
      Parameters:
      userId - the id for the user requesting their Reviewer list
      reviewer - the Reviewer that will be updated.
      Returns:
      boolean

    • register

      public void register(User user) throws SQLException
      Allows a new User to be registered to the database. This adds a new row to the User table.
      Parameters:
      user - the User object that will be added.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error in accessing the column.

    • register

      public void register(String request) throws SQLException
      A method for creating a request to become a Reviewer. This request will then show up to the Admin to be approved.
      Parameters:
      request - a message detailing why the user should be a reviewer.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error in accessing the column.

    • updateRoles

      public void updateRoles(String username, String roles) throws SQLException
      This allows a User to have their roles updated. An Admin has to request new roles to be added or removed.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the User to be updated
      roles - a comma separated string that contains the roles to be updated.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error in accessing the column.

    • updatePassword

      public void updatePassword(String username, String password)
      Will update the password that is stored in the database for this user.
      Parameters:
      username - the username for the password to be updated.
      password - the new password to be updated.

    • updateOTPFlag

      public void updateOTPFlag(String username, boolean flag)
      Allows the persistence of a One Time Password flag to be stored in the database. Used when an admin has sent the user a One Time Password.
      Parameters:
      username - the username for the User that has requested the One Time Password.
      flag - a boolean for the new One Time password flag

    • getUser

      public User getUser(String username) throws SQLException
      Returns the User object that is associated with the username.
      Parameters:
      username - the username for the User to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      User
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error in accessing the column.

    • getUser

      public User getUser(int id) throws SQLException
      Returns the User object that is associated with the ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the id for the User requested.
      Returns:
      User
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error in accessing the column.

    • addRoles

      public boolean addRoles(String username, String newRole) throws SQLException
      Allows a role to be added to a User. Calls the updateRoles function above.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the user adding a role to
      newRole - the new role to be added
      Returns:
      boolean for if the role got added
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error in accessing the column.

    • banUser

      public boolean banUser(String username)
      Bans a user by setting their 'banned' status to TRUE in the database.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the user to ban
      Returns:
      true if the user was successfully banned; false otherwise

    • unbanUser

      public boolean unbanUser(String username)
      Unbans a user by setting their 'banned' status to FALSE in the database.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the user to unban
      Returns:
      true if the user was successfully unbanned; false otherwise

    • isUserBanned

      public boolean isUserBanned(String username)
      Checks if a user is currently banned.
      Parameters:
      username - the username to check
      Returns:
      true if the user is banned; false otherwise or if an error occurs

    • removeRoles

      public boolean removeRoles(String username, String newRole) throws SQLException
      This function will remove a role form the user who's username is passed in. This will call the updateRoles function from above.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the user that will have roles removed.
      newRole - a string containing the role that will be removed.
      Returns:
      boolean
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error in accessing the column.

    • deleteRequest

      public boolean deleteRequest(String username)
      This function will delete a request to be a reviewer from the current user that is logged in. Can be used if the user no longer wants to be a reviewer after submitting their request.
      Parameters:
      username - the id for the user requesting their Reviewer list
      Returns:
      boolean

    • deleteUser

      public boolean deleteUser(String username)
      This function will allow a user to be deleted from the database and no longer be able to log in. You are not able to delete your own account if you are logged in.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the user that will have their account deleted.
      Returns:
      boolean

    • getAllUsers

      public List<User> getAllUsers() throws SQLException
      This function will retrieve all of the users that are currently in the database. Will create User objects from the rows that are returned.
      Returns:
      a List of Users that are in the database.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error in accessing the column.

    • getAllRequestsA

      public List<Request> getAllRequestsA() throws SQLException
      Method to retrieve all requests from the database
      Returns:
      A List of Request objects representing all requests in the database
      Throws:
      SQLException - SQL exception throw

    • getAllRequests

      public List<Request> getAllRequests() throws SQLException
      Gets all of the requests for reviewers that Users have submitted. Used to display to an Admin in order for them to approve/deny the request.
      Returns:
      a List of Requests that are in the database.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error in accessing the column.

    • getAllReviewerRequests

      public List<Request> getAllReviewerRequests() throws SQLException
      Retrieves all reviewer requests from the database.

      This method executes a SQL query to select all rows from the cse360request table where the column requestATOF is true, indicating that the request is intended for reviewer operations. Each retrieved row is converted into a Request object using the buildRequestFromResultSet(ResultSet) method.

      Returns:
      a list of Request objects representing all reviewer requests.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs or the SQL query fails.

    • updateRequestStatus

      public void updateRequestStatus(String userName, boolean requestTOF, boolean requestATOF) throws SQLException
      This method updates the request by the user, typically only for making it visible to the admin, and removing it from the Instructors view
      Parameters:
      userName - the username for the request being updated
      requestTOF - a boolean to tell if the request is still active.
      requestATOF - a boolean to tell if the request has been accepted.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error in accessing the column.

    • getAllRequestsForAdmin

      public List<Request> getAllRequestsForAdmin() throws SQLException
      This method gets all the requests that the admin should see.
      Returns:
      a List of Requests that are in the database.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error in accessing the column.

    • getAllUsersWithRole

      public List<User> getAllUsersWithRole(String role) throws SQLException
      This method returns all of the Users in the database that have a specific role assigned to them.
      Parameters:
      role - the role that the query will return Users for.
      Returns:
      a List of Users in the database that have this role.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error in accessing the column.

    • login

      public User login(String username, String password) throws SQLException
      This method allows a User to login if the username and password match what is in the database.
      Parameters:
      username - the username that the user is logging in with
      password - the password that the user is logging in with
      Returns:
      User
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error in accessing the column.

    • doesUserExist

      public boolean doesUserExist(String username)
      This method checks if the User with the given username is in the database.
      Parameters:
      username - the username being checked if it exists.
      Returns:
      boolean

    • getUserRole

      public List<String> getUserRole(String username)
      This method returns all of the roles that the User with the given username has.
      Parameters:
      username - the username to get the roles from.
      Returns:
      a List of Strings that represent the roles the user has.

    • generateInvitationCode

      public String generateInvitationCode()
      Generates a Invitation Code that will be used to allow a new User to register their login.
      Returns:
      String

    • generateOneTimePassword

      public String generateOneTimePassword()
      Generates a random One Time Password that the user can user to login and reset their password.
      Returns:
      String

    • validateInvitationCode

      public boolean validateInvitationCode(String code)
      Validates the previously generated Invitation code that exists in the database.
      Parameters:
      code - the invitation code being used
      Returns:
      boolean

    • setUserCurrentRole

      public void setUserCurrentRole(String role)
      Sets the user logged in to have the most current role for this class to stay updated.
      Parameters:
      role - the role to be set as the current role

    • closeConnection

      public void closeConnection()
      Closes the connection to the database. .
